Hi!
I'm having the following error:

pedro@solari:~$ leanproject
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/pedro/.local/bin/leanproject", line 5, in <module>
    from mathlibtools.leanproject import safe_cli
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'mathlibtools'

Context:
I haven't been using Lean for a while, and I set to port to Lean4 one of my projects using the mathport instructions (cleaner link).

At some point (certainly at or before the first to require leanproject) I noticed its failure. I checked that VSCode opens the folder of the project without problems (it compiles; Lean is working there).

This seems to be some Python problem; not sure if some recent update broke mine (I'm using Debian Testing).
I tried to reinstall the leanproject part using the last bullet point of the Controlled installation of Lean and mathlib on Debian/Ubuntu, but it complained about pipx:

pedro@solari:~$ python3 -m pip install --user pipx
error: externally-managed-environment

√ó This environment is externally managed
‚ï∞‚îÄ> To install Python packages system-wide, try apt install
    python3-xyz, where xyz is the package you are trying to
    install.

    If you wish to install a non-Debian-packaged Python package,
    create a virtual environment using python3 -m venv path/to/venv.
    Then use path/to/venv/bin/python and path/to/venv/bin/pip. Make
    sure you have python3-full installed.

    If you wish to install a non-Debian packaged Python application,
    it may be easiest to use pipx install xyz, which will manage a
    virtual environment for you. Make sure you have pipx installed.

    See /usr/share/doc/python3.11/README.venv for more information.

note: If you believe this is a mistake, please contact your Python installation or OS distribution provider. You can override this, at the risk of breaking your Python installation or OS, by passing --break-system-packages.
hint: See PEP 668 for the detailed specification.

In any case, I do also have pipx installed as a standalone package, and when I tried pipx install mathlibtools (after failing the standard instructions), I got:

/home/pedro/.local/pipx/shared/bin/python: No module named pip
Failed to upgrade shared libraries
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/pipx/shared_libs.py", line 113, in upgrade
    subprocess_post_check(upgrade_process)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/pipx/util.py", line 203, in subprocess_post_check
    raise PipxError(
pipx.util.PipxError: '/home/pedro/.local/pipx/shared/bin/python -m pip --disable-pip-version-check install -q --upgrade pip setuptools wheel' failed
'mathlibtools' already seems to be installed. Not modifying existing installation in '/home/pedro/.local/pipx/venvs/mathlibtools'. Pass '--force' to force
installation.

Extra info:

pedro@solari:~$ elan -V
elan 1.4.5 (b325638d9 2023-04-26)

I'm really sorry to bother with this; I really do not know if it was my fault. Thanks in advance.
Do you recall how you initially installed leanproject (also known as mathlibtools)? I would be trying to uninstall it first, then reinstall it from scratch.

So perhaps just

pipx uninstall mathlibtools
pipx install mathlibtools

?

Scott Morrison said:

Do you recall how you initially installed leanproject (also known as mathlibtools)? I would be trying to uninstall it first, then reinstall it from scratch.

Yes indeed, after a short ‚Äúhacker‚Äù hesitation, I decided to follow the quick instructions that put everything in (even VSCode, in spite of my being an Emacs fan). I'll try re-installing as you suggest. Thank you very much!

I had errors while uninstalling, but it succeeded:

pedro@solari:~$ pipx uninstall mathlibtools
/home/pedro/.local/pipx/shared/bin/python: No module named pip
Failed to upgrade shared libraries
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/pipx/shared_libs.py", line 113, in upgrade
    subprocess_post_check(upgrade_process)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/pipx/util.py", line 203, in subprocess_post_check
    raise PipxError(
pipx.util.PipxError: '/home/pedro/.local/pipx/shared/bin/python -m pip --disable-pip-version-check install -q --upgrade pip setuptools wheel' failed
uninstalled mathlibtools! ‚ú® üåü ‚ú®

BUT, pipx didn't let me install it again with a fatal error, and produced a log file containing:

PIP STDOUT
----------

PIP STDERR
----------
/home/pedro/.local/pipx/venvs/mathlibtools/bin/python: No module named pip

I seems there's something very wrong with my Python... Conflicting versions maybe?

It seems I found a solution! (For Ubuntu/Debian)

Here it states that

It appears this happens when the Python version is upgraded (to a major version) on a machine on which pipx was installed and used before.

The best solution I could find to solve this issue is to remove the ~/.local/pipx/shared folder (or you can move it somewhere if you wish), which holds shared pipx libraries, then get pipx to reinstall the shared libraries [...]:

mv ~/.local/pipx/shared ~/.local/pipx/shared.old
pipx list

After this, I was able run

pipx install mathlibtools

successfully, and leanproject was good to go again.
Pedro S√°nchez Terraf has marked this topic as resolved.
Thanks @Scott Morrison for the hint!
